channel.title: Making Defenders...help!
channel.description:
Hewo fellow people,
I'm about 63% through making a pking server, and I would just like to see if anyone can help me. You see...I'm making my own version of defenders by placing daggers into the shields bit. But I go into the [item bit ( the one where u make the things go into the right spot) and I've place the daggers into the shields part hoping that they'd be in the shield equip slot, but they aren't. Could some please help me.

item.title: Making Defenders...help!
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

elite azn:

so what ur saying is that Jagex have made it so that we can’t get the things anymore (you lost me)

Congratulations, that is exactly right! I will be less of an insulting jerk to you now and clear up the place I lost you.

All the models for the items, and information on the spots on your character where they get wielded are stored in a large random access file called the cache. When you log on to RS using Jagex’s official client (basically, the only way they encourage one to join RS) the client downloads the file and waits for you to press the “Login” button. When you log in, the client preextracts the contents of the cache to that it can automatically render models and images as you see them. Now, the MoparScape client is basically version 317 of Jagex’s RS client. Some time after version 420, Jagex heavily updated their client and the cache so that their client and cache both work together “properly”, however our old 317 clients can’t work right [with the new cache] anymore.

You may say “Well, why not just use Jagex’s client instead of MoparScape ?” well, that is because Jagex’s new client responds extremely differently that the 317 does to the same signals that the 317 responds to. So, for example, if your server wanted the client to update the image with “Draw a picture of a dragon 2h on the ground at tile 453,6533” then the 317 would do just that. However, if your server told a 420 + client to do that, the client would crash.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Defenders...help!
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

so what ur saying is that Jagex have made it so that we can't get the things anymore (you lost me)

He’s saying that it’s harder now for people to update, and people are lazy, so nobody really wants to make a newer version of the server.

So, they 
*   Encrypt the cache
*   Obfuscate the client
*   Maintain a less than crappy connection</blockquote>

On the other hand, it wouldn’t take too much effort to make a 317 client that had duel wielding weapons. I remember making cows with two heads for a client around when WL released the first private server a long time ago…the 317 era clients were not hard to edit graphics-wise. You might even be able to make the whole edit in Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub6.java.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Defenders...help!
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Jagex has finally gotten it through their swollen head and linked together the facts that people are going to continue ripping off their moronic game as long as

1: The cache is freely obtainable
2: The client is freely obtainable
3: The client will connect to whatever you tell it

and that people cannot play their moronic game unless

a) The cache is freely obtainable
b) The client is freely obtainable
c) The client will connect to whatever you tell it

So, they

[] Encrypt the cache
[] Obfuscate the client
[*] Maintain a less than crappy connection

Read full topic
